page.title: 19BOAT BLAST
page.content: ONE SATURDAY MORNING IN AUGUST THE WHOLE VILLAGE HEARD A VERY LOUD BANG FOLLOWED BY A SMALLER EXPLOSION .EVERYONE RUSHED DOWN TO THE HARBOUR TO SEE WHAT HAD HAPPENED .WHILE WORKING ON THE BOAT CALLED THE LIBERTY SCOTT'S GRANDFATHER HAD BEEN SMOKING A CIGARETTE AND IT HAD FALLEN NEAR A GAS CYLINDER WHICH MUST HAVE BEEN LEAKING .LUCKILY HE WAS NOT KILLED BUT HE WAS VERY BADLY BURNED .THE DECK OF THE LIBERTY WAS BLOWN RIGHT INTO THE AIR AND LANDED ON TOP OF THE WHEELHOUSE . THE BOW WAS SPLIT IN HALF AND FISH BASKETS AND BOXES WERE THROWN ON TO THE BEACH .THE FIRE ENGINE , TWO POLICE CARS AND AN AMBULANCE ARRIVED ON THE SCENE AND THE FIRE WAS SOON UNDER CONTROL .SCOTT'S GRANDFATHER WAS RUSHED TO HOSPITAL IN EDINBURGH .IN SPITE OF THE BIG BLAST THE RADIO TRANSMITTER WAS STILL WORKING.
